intro: Perpensum blitispermum, commonly known as the blitispermum perpensum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The small white or greenish flowers appear in late spring, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
